{{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''EastEnders'' characters (2011)}} The following is a list of characters who first appeared or are due to appear in the [[BBC]] [[soap opera]] ''[[EastEnders]]'' in 2011, by order of first appearance. All characters are introduced by the series' executive producer, [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]]. The first main character to be announced was [[Eddie Moon]], the father of [[Michael Moon (EastEnders)|Michael Moon]]. [[Poppy Meadow]] was introduced in January 2011, and [[#Rob Grayson|Rob Grayson]] joined the series in February, as did [[#Shenice Quinn|Shenice Quinn]]. [[#Ashley Chubb|Ashley Chubb]] was introduced in March as the father of established character [[Fatboy (EastEnders)|Fatboy]]. In April, [[Janine Butcher]]'s grandmother, [[#Lydia Simmonds|Lydia Simmonds]], and [[Tanya Branning]] and [[Rainie Cross]]'s mother, [[#Cora Cross|Cora Cross]], both joined the series and [[#Martin|Martin]] was introduced as the new love interest for [[Jane Beale]]. Eddie's sons [[#Tyler Moon|Tyler]] and [[#Anthony Moon|Anthony]] were announced in May along with [[Dot Branning]]'s half sister, [[#Rose|Rose]]. [[Lola Pearce]], the granddaughter of [[Billy Mitchell (EastEnders)|Billy Mitchell]] and [[Julie Perkins]], was announced in June along with [[#Norman Simmonds|Norman Simmonds]], Lydia's son. A fourth Moon brother was introduced in September, [[#Craig Moon|Craig]], as well as [[#Faith Olubunmi|Faith Olubunmi]], the younger sister of [[Mercy Olubunmi]].
{{TOC limit|limit=2}}
==Poppy Meadow== {{Main|Poppy Meadow}} '''Poppy Meadow''', played by [[Rachel Bright]], was introduced on 11 January 2011 as the best friend of established character [[Jodie Gold]] ([[Kylie Babbington]]), and appeared in several "filler" scenes which were substituted for cuts made from a controversial baby-swap storyline.<ref name="11jan">{{Cite episode |title= 11/01/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00xh7lz |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Jennie Darnell (director), Carey Andrews (writer)|network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]]|airdate=11 January 2011}}</ref><ref name="13jan">{{Cite episode |title= 13/01/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00xh6xw |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Jennie Darnell (director), Carey Andrews (writer)|network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=13 January 2011}}</ref> Poppy returned in June 2011 as a supporting character, and began working alongside Jodie as a beautician.<ref name="Reasons to stay">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a319136/eastenders-star-jodie-has-reasons-to-stay.html|title='EastEnders' star: 'Jodie has reasons to stay'|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=12 May 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=12 May 2011}}</ref> Her storylines focussed on her friendship with Jodie and their intertwined love-lives, as the two added a comedy element to the series. Both characters departed on 14 November 2011.<ref name="last">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a349326/phils-past-comes-back-to-haunt-him.html|title=Phil's past comes back to haunt him|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=14 November 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines]]|accessdate=8 November 2011}}</ref>
Critics gave a mixed responses to Poppy's introduction, which was deemed alternately "bizarre and utterly irrelevant",<ref name="filler">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1347655/EastEnders-bosses-spark-fan-fury-axing-key-funeral-scenes-controversial-cot-death-plot.html|title=EastEnders bosses spark more fan fury after axing key funeral scenes in controversial cot-death plot|last=Thompson|first=Jody|date=16 January 2011|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|accessdate=16 January 2011|location=London}}</ref> and "a welcome addition to the show".<ref name="welcome">{{cite news|url=http://www.pressandjournal.co.uk/Article.aspx/2089675/?UserKey=|title=Getting all in a lather over controversial soap storylines|last=Lord|first=Derek|date=14 January 2011|work=[[The Press and Journal (Scotland)|The Press and Journal]]|publisher=[[D. C. Thomson & Co.]]|accessdate=16 January 2011|location=Aberdeen}}</ref> ''[[The Guardian]]''{{'s}} Stuart Heritage deemed Poppy "perhaps the greatest television bit-part character of the modern age".<ref name="Poppy Stuart Heritage">{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/tv-and-radio/tvandradioblog/2011/feb/04/tv-bit-part-characters-eastenders-poppy-meadow|title=TV's top bit-part characters|last=Heritage|first=Stuart|date=4 February 2011|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=[[Guardian News and Media]]|accessdate=4 February 2011|location=London}}</ref> Her return attracted more favourable reviews from the tabloid press; several ''[[Daily Mirror]]'' writers have given Poppy positive reviews, and ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' criticised her axing.<ref name="TOWIE">{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/3888941/Its-the-EastEnder-of-this-trio.html|title=Itâs the EastEnder of this trio|date=24 October 2011|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|publisher=[[News International]]|first=Colin|last=Robertson|accessdate=1 November 2011|location=London}}</ref>
==Rob Grayson== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Rob Grayson |caption = |portrayer = [[Jody Latham]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2011|Former; guest]] |first = 22 February 2011 |last = 26 August 2011 |years = 2011 |death = 25 August 2011<!-- episode dated, not necessarily set on that date, so unsure --> |occupation = [[Pimp]] }} '''Rob Grayson''', played by [[Jody Latham]], is a [[pimp]] who exploits [[Whitney Dean]] ([[Shona McGarty]]) for financial gain.<ref name="22feb">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 22/02/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00yz513 |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Gwennan Sage; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Perrie Balthazar|network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=22 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.pendletoday.co.uk/news/local-news/barrowford_actor_jody_latham_to_appear_in_eastenders_1_2928859|title=Barrowford actor Jody Latham to appear in 'Eastenders'|work=Pendle Today|publisher=[[Johnston Publishing]]|accessdate=15 January 2011}}</ref> His first appearance was on 22 February 2011,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/scoop/a303795/first-look-jody-latham-as-eastenders-rob.html|title=First Look: Jody Latham as 'EastEnders' Rob|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=15 February 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=15 February 2011|location=London}}</ref> and he appeared until a special [[Comic Relief]] episode on 18 March 2011. He made a short return from 19 August 2011<ref name="run"/> until 26 August 2011.
He first appears when he witnesses Whitney attempting to pickpocket a man but ending up with cuts on her face.Rob rescues her from the situation,<ref>{{cite web |title= Janine and Whitney get up to no good|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a303725/janine-and-whitney-get-up-to-no-good.html|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|work=[[Digital Spy]]|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=February 2011|accessdate=15 February 2011}}</ref> and buys her a meal. He gives her his number so she can contact him any time she needs get away, before taking her home. They stay in contact and Rob is seen showing a friend a photo of Whitney. When Whitney either rejects or is rejected by all her friends and family, she contacts Rob and he takes her to stay with him. After Whitney has been missing for several days, [[Lauren Branning]] ([[Jacqueline Jossa]]) tries to phone her, leaving several messages. When she finally gets a voicemail back, it is from Rob saying if she calls again, there will be trouble.
Lauren tracks Whitney down to [[Dartford]], but Whitney insists she is fine with Rob, and that they are in love. Rob meets Lauren at their bedsit and invites her out with them, but Lauren leaves. Rob then leaves Whitney alone with [[#Chris|Chris]] (Richard Simons) and it is revealed that Rob is using Whitney to pay off his debts. Rob meets Lauren in a cafÃ© and again invites her out and calls her beautiful. He then threatens her, saying he does not want to see her again. When Rob returns to the bedsit, Whitney is there with [[Janine Malloy]] ([[Charlie Brooks]]), who says she is taking Whitney home. Whitney refuses to go and Rob ejects Janine from the building. Rob then tells Whitney they are going out immediately, and drags her to the car as she refuses to go. Lauren and Janine watch as Rob drives away with Whitney. Rob takes Whitney to a house where she meets [[#Chloe|Chloe]] ([[Georgia Henshaw]]), another girl being exploited. Whitney realises she is there to have sex with men, so asks Rob if she can leave. Rob says to either be nice to his friends or he will hurt her. He grabs her and locks her in a room. She is unable to open the windows so when she hears people outside the door, she smashes a window, jumps to the ground and runs away with Rob calling after her. She then stops a car and asks for help. She later returns to Walford after being arrested for shoplifting. Her half brother [[Ryan Malloy]] ([[Neil McDermott]]) learns of what happened and wants to find Rob but Whitney says he has moved.
When Whitney starts a relationship with a man named [[#Lee|Lee]] (Mitchell Hunt), it is revealed that he is a friend of Rob's, and when Whitney agrees to meet Lee by text, Rob takes control of Lee's mobile phone. Whitney goes to meet Lee and is shocked to see Rob instead. She is taken in by his charm until she texts Lee not to come, and then sees the message on Rob's phone. She allows Rob to take her home but then tells him to wait outside while she escapes through the back door and hitches a lift to [[Southend-on-Sea]] with friends. She leaves Rob a voicemail message not knowing that he has followed her. He finds her in her hotel room and tells her how much he loves her, but when Fatboy comes in, Rob attacks him, so Whitney tells him to leave. Fatboy calls Ryan, who comes to Southend to look for Rob. When he finds him, they fight and fall over the edge of the pier. A body is recovered from the sea, and is later revealed to be Rob's.
===Development=== In January 2011, it was announced that Whitney would be part of the sexual exploitation storyline. She is left alone and vulnerable, and falls for Rob, who then exploits her. ''EastEnders'' worked alongside charity [[Comic Relief]] on the storyline, which started planning in 2010. The storyline culminated during [[Red Nose Day 2011]] on 18 March 2011, in a special 10-minute episode.<ref name="Sex explotation plot"/> Gilly Green, Head of UK Grants at Comic Relief, said: "It is vital that we continue to alert young people to the dangers if we are to stop them being exploited and the opportunity to work with ''EastEnders'' will make a huge audience aware of this issue. We have been working with the ''EastEnders'' script writers and some of the young women from projects we support to ensure the story reflects the reality of young people caught up in sexual exploitation."<ref name="Humphreys">{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/eastenders/2011/01/comicrelief.shtml|title=EastEnders working with Comic Relief|last=Humphreys|first=Matt|date=9 January 2011|work=EastEnders|publisher=BBC|accessdate=9 January 2011}}</ref> Kevin Cahill, Chief Executive of Comic Relief, added "We have worked over many years with ''EastEnders'' in all kinds of ways. It's been a real pleasure this year to work together on a piece of serious drama, in the best traditions of public service, which will highlight an important issue and also, because it occurs on the night of Comic Relief, actually help raise crucial funds to help young women caught up in it."<ref name="Sex explotation plot">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a296873/eastenders-confirms-sex-exploitation-plot.html|title='EastEnders' confirms sex exploitation plot|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=10 January 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=26 February 2011|location=London}}</ref> An ''EastEnders'' insider spoke of the storyline leading up to Rob's arrival: "Janine's a terrible influence and is soon dragging Whitney into all sorts of shady schemes. Given that Janine used to be a prostitute, it makes sense that she's part of Whitney's journey. Whitney has no idea what she's letting herself in for. Janine is only part of the problem though. It's when she meets Robâa deeply unscrupulous manâthat her life starts to fall apart in a terrifying way."<ref name="The List">{{cite news|url=http://www.list.co.uk/article/32056-eastenders-whitney-to-turn-to-prostitution/|title=EastEnders' Whitney to turn to prostitution|work=[[The List (magazine)|The List]]|publisher=The List Ltd|date=20 January 2011|accessdate=24 March 2011}}</ref> Rob has been called "evil" by ''The People''<ref name="The People"/> and by executive producer [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]],<ref name="ebcar"/> a "nasty piece of work" by [[Orange (telecommunications)|Orange]],<ref name="Orange">{{cite news|url=http://www.orange.co.uk/entertainment/television/24478.htm|title=Janine to meet her match|publisher=[[Orange (telecommunications)|Orange]]|accessdate=24 March 2011}}</ref> "sinister" by Daniel Kilkelly from [[Digital Spy]]<ref name="ebcar">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a322573/eastenders-boss-confirms-affair-plot-rumours.html|title='EastEnders' boss confirms affair plot rumours|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=1 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=1 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> and "vicious"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/features/3457207/New-EastEnders-plot-sees-Whitney-Dean-exploited-as-a-sex-slave.html|title= EastEnders plot highlights horror of sex slavery|date=10 March 2011|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|publisher=[[News Group Newspapers]]|accessdate=8 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> and "vile"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/soaps/3433900/Ricky-Butcher-caught-in-EastEnders-vice-plot.html|title=Ricky caught in Enders vice plot|date=25 February 2011|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|accessdate=8 June 2011}}</ref> by ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]''.
McGarty hoped the storyline would raise awareness of the issue for young people,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a304385/mcgarty-hopes-for-positive-enders-impact.html|title=McGarty hopes for positive 'Enders impact|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=23 February 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=13 March 2011|location=London}}</ref> and explained that the storyline would be a continuing one, as "Whitney will live in fear that Rob and his gang are going to come after her when she escapes. That's what these people do. They don't just leave you to get on with your life. In their mind they own you."<ref name="Meeting People">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a308693/mcgarty-sex-exploitation-is-shocking.html|title=McGarty: 'Sex exploitation is shocking'|last=Daniels|first=Colin|date=13 March 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=13 March 2011|location=London}}</ref> She also added that she hopes that the storyline will lead to better conviction rates as she said that they aren't 'good enough'.<ref name="Meeting People"/> Latham met real-life prostitutes at a drop-in centre as research, which he described as "heartbreaking".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/soaps/3485548/EastEnder-Jody-Latham-wept-after-meeting-prostitutes-to-research-role.html|title=Enders pimp's tears over real vice girls |last=Patrick|first=Guy|date=23 March 2011|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|accessdate=23 March 2011}}</ref> Latham revealed after his stint that he hoped to return, saying, "I always say it's better to play the bad guyâeveryone remembers the bad guy. They get the best endings. I had an absolutely great time on ''EastEnders''. It was a breath of fresh air. [...] Judging from the way it was left, the door is wide open, so you never know. I would love to come back and cause some trouble."<ref name="ok">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a313092/jody-latham-hopes-for-eastenders-return.html|title=Jody Latham hopes for 'EastEnders' return|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=6 April 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=1 May 2011|location=London}}</ref>
On 1 May 2011 it was reported by the ''[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]'' that Latham would return to ''EastEnders'' in a couple of weeks time to film the conclusion to the storyline. A source said, "Whitney will not be going back on the streets but the writers felt the storyline needed to be tied up so Jody is coming back for a couple of episodes. Whitney is currently having to come to terms with everything that she did while under Rob's spell and she's not coping very well. She's trying to move on but, with everyone knowing that she worked as a prostitute, she's finding it all very Â­difficult. The writers decided it would be good for her to come face to face with Rob again once she's strong enough to do so. They've written the conclusion to her storyline and Jody will be back to film the dramatic ending in a couple of weeks time. Rob is set to finally get his come-uppance."<ref name="Latham returning"/> An ''EastEnders'' spokeperson confirmed this.<ref name="Latham returning">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/posts/view/188757/Evil-pimp-poised-for-return-to-Albert-Square/|title=Evil pimp poised for return to Albert Square|last=Hill|first=Susan|date=1 May 2011|work=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]|publisher=[[Northern & Shell]]|accessdate=1 May 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Kirkwood said that Rob would return when Whitney is at her most vulnerable, following the reveal of her brother Ryan's affair with her best friend Lauren.<ref name="ebcar"/> Scenes were filmed in [[Southend-on-Sea]], [[Essex]], for Rob's return, after Ryan tracks Rob down<ref name="pier">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a323763/eastenders-stuntman-injured-in-pier-fall.html|title='EastEnders' stuntman injured in pier fall|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=8 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=8 June 2011|location=London}}</ref> and finds Whitney with him.<ref name="f&w">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2001019/EastEnders-Shona-McGarty-Ricky-Norwood-shoot-scenes-fair-prostitution-plot-comes-end.html|title=EastEnders' Shona McGarty and Ricky Norwood shoot scenes at the fair as prostitution plot comes to an end |date=8 June 2011|work=[[Daily Mail|The Mail]]|accessdate=8 June 2011|location=London}}</ref> It was revealed by the ''[[News of the World]]'' that Ryan and Rob will have a massive showdown on the pier, and Ryan will murder Rob as revenge for forcing Whitney into prostitution.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a326872/eastenders-character-to-commit-murder.html|title='EastEnders' character 'to commit murder'|last=Daniels|first=Colin|date=26 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=26 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Ryan will then go on the run from the police, not wanting to get caught for murdering Rob.<ref name="run">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a326599/eastenders-character-to-go-on-the-run.html|title='EastEnders' character 'to go on the run'|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=24 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=24 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref>
It was reported by ''[[The People]]'' that Latham had received criticism from viewers who struggled to understand his [[Burnley]] accent.<ref name="The People">{{cite news|url=http://www.people.co.uk/celebs-tv/celebrities/2011/03/06/eastenders-fans-struggle-with-jody-latham-s-broad-burnley-brogue-102039-22969101/|title=EastEnders fans struggle with Jody Latham's broad Burnley brogue |last=Dorman|first=Nick|date=6 March 2011|work=[[The People]]|publisher=[[Trinity Mirror]]|accessdate=24 March 2011}}</ref> He said, "I'm sorry people are having Â­difficulty with my accent. I'm sure the great fans of ''EastEnders'' will get used to it!"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a307377/jody-latham-fans-will-get-used-to-accent.html|title=Jody Latham: 'Fans will get used to accent'|last=Daniels|first=Colin|date=6 March 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=6 March 2011|location=London}}</ref> The storyline reportedly received criticism from fans. The BBC issued a statement, saying:
{{blockquote|The ''EastEnders'' audience would have been aware of the dark situation Whitney was getting into. In the preceding episodes viewers saw Whitney feeling increasingly unwanted and unloved, with her brother and her step-mother absent, her life was taking a downward spiral. [...] It was a natural progression of Whitney's story thus far and we felt it was an important story to tell, and hopefully to raise awareness of amongst our audience. In doing so, we believe it was right to show theâalbeit unpleasantâreality of the situation faced by these girls, rather than put a gloss on it. In the episode Whitney is seen to escape and to raise the alarmâwe did not leave the audience on a cliffhanger. The menace and danger Whitney is in whilst clear is implied rather than graphic or sensationalised and is in keeping with the audience expectations of how ''EastEnders'' would tackle a tough story in a pre-watershed manner and indeed how Whitney's story has evolved over the last few years. We are conscious that Red Nose Day programming includes many different tones and themes, ranging from light comedy sketches to difficult and emotional appeal films, all of which played out around the time the ''EastEnders'' episode was scheduled to transmit. We hope that the majority of the audience would have heard the first extended warning and that the serious tone of the introduction, though truncated, pointed to the fact that the upcoming film was a gear change. It was further put into context by the presenters at the end of the piece, when they talked about the Comic Relief-funded charities working to help girls like Whitney."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a310633/bbc-defends-enders-comic-relief-episode.html|title=BBC defends 'Enders Comic Relief episode|last=Love|first=Ryan|date=23 March 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=23 March 2011|location=London}}</ref>}}
Speaking about how members of the public reacted to the storyline, Latham told ''[[OK!]]'', "Considering Rob makes [[Phil Mitchell]] look like a field mouse, I've got to be quite grateful. I've not had a tin of baked beans chucked at me in Asda by some nice old lady. It's just a bit of banter off the public, which I relish. I've not had anyone threaten to beat me up yet, which is a plus point!"<ref>{{cite journal|date=12 April 2011|title=At home with 'EastEnders' star Jody Latham|journal=[[OK!]]|issue=771|page=56|publisher=[[Northern & Shell]]}}</ref>
==Shenice Quinn== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series=EastEnders |name=Shenice Quinn |portrayer=Lily Harvey |introducer=[[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |years=2011â |first=28 February 2011 |last= |classification=[[List of characters from EastEnders#Recurring and guest characters|Present; recurring]] |born=10 March 2003<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a306161/kat-hides-her-real-feelings.html|title=Kat hides her real feelings|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|year=2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=8 March 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> |mother=[[#Martina Quinn|Martina Quinn]] }} '''Shenice Quinn''', played by nine-year-old Lily Harvey,<ref name="28feb">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 28/02/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00z522j |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Alex Kalymnios; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Michael Begley |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=28 February 2011}}</ref><ref name="Martina Shenice" /> is the daughter of [[#Martina Quinn|Martina Quinn]] (Tamara Wall), who it is an old friend of [[Kat Moon]]'s ([[Jessie Wallace]]) from [[Spain]]. Martina reported Kat and her husband [[Alfie Moon]] ([[Shane Richie]]) to the police in Spain, leading to some animosity between Kat and Martina. Martina and Shenice arrive at [[The Queen Victoria]], and Kat immediately throws water over Martina. However, she reveals that her bar was smashed up by the police and she was worried that she would lose Shenice if she did not tell the truth.<ref name="Kilkelly">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/scoop/a305113/pics-enders-newcomers-martina-and-shenice.html|title=Pics: 'Enders newcomers Martina and Shenice|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=22 February 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=22 February 2011|location=London}}</ref> Alfie bonds with Shenice, and Martina tells Kat that she has lost her bar and has nothing left, so Kat allows her them to stay. After a night out with Kat, Martina spends the day in bed. Kat later finds Shenice wearing her clothes and makeup. Kat shouts at Shenice to take the clothes off, and Shenice flinches thinking Kat is going to hit her. The next day, Shenice is caught trying to steal cigarettes from the local shop, which Kat chastises a drunken Martina for. Martina calls her daughter useless before going to bed, and Shenice tells Kat and Alfie that Martina says things she does not mean when she is drunk. The next day, Martina tells Kat that she will get some money so she and Shenice can move out and that she is back with her boyfriend. Kat and Alfie organise a birthday party for Shenice as Martina has forgotten and Shenice takes a disliking to [[Tiffany Butcher]] ([[Maisie Smith]]) as they are wearing the same outfit. Shenice has to leave half-way through the party as Martina finds a place to live, and they move out, leaving Alfie and Kat distraught.
Kat and Alfie holiday in Spain and return with Shenice. Shenice and Tiffany become friends but Shenice becomes bored as Kat cannot take her and Tiffany out anywhere because of Kat's baby [[Tommy Moon|Tommy]]. Shenice bonds with Kat's relative [[Jean Slater]] ([[Gillian Wright]]) after helping her plant some window boxes. When Shenice is due to go back to Spain, she begs to stay in Walford and Alfie agrees.
===Development=== Harvey is the real-life sister of [[Lacey Turner]] who played [[Stacey Slater]]. Shenice is described as a cheeky youngster.<ref name="Martina Shenice" /> Harvey and Wall started filming in January 2011<ref name="Martina Shenice" /> and first appear on screen on 28 February 2011.<ref name="Martina">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a303087/yusef-provides-support-for-Denise.html|title=Yusef provides support for Denise|author=Daniel Kilkelly|date=February 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=10 February 2011|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5wOpo5tnu|archivedate=10 February 2011}}</ref> Harvey has grown up around the ''EastEnders'' set but had to audition for the part.<ref name="Martina Shenice">{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/soaps/3310840/Eastenders-Lacey-Turner-leaves-soap-but-her-little-sister-Lily-Harvey-joins-cast.html|title=Stacey's lil sis joins EastEnders|last=Blackburn|first=Jen|date=21 December 2010|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|publisher=[[News Group Newspapers]]|accessdate=21 December 2010|location=London}}</ref> Producers were unaware that Harvey and Turner were related until after the casting was made. Executive producer [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] explained: "I sat down and watched a tape of a very talented young girl and it was only after we decided to cast [Harvey] that I was told [she] was [Turner]'s sister. [Harvey] got the role entirely on her own merits."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a294415/turners-sister-cast-on-own-merits.html|title=Turner's sister 'cast on own merits'|last=Rainey|first=Naomi|date=21 December 2010|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=22 December 2010|location=London}}</ref> In April 2011 it was announced that Harvey would be reprising the role. It was reported that Kat and Alfie will meet Martina and Shenice while on holiday in Spain. A source told ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' that "Kat and Alfie have just got their family back together when they turn up with another kid in tow. Poor old Shenice has not been having a great time in Spain with her mum, who won't win any prizes for mother of the year. Martina may be an old friend, but Kat is fed up because she keeps neglecting her daughter and going on the razz. She seems incapable of settling down. So she and Alfie convince Martina that Shenice would be better off back with them in Walford. Alfie has missed her like mad."<ref name="Shenice return">{{cite web|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/soaps/3551412/EastEnders-Kat-and-Alfie-back-from-Spain-with-tearaway-Shenice-Quinn.html|title=Look what the Kat dragged in|first=Colin|last=Robertson|date=28 April 2011|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|publisher=[[News Group Newspapers]]|accessdate=28 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> It was said she will be returning for a number of weeks,<ref name="Shenice return"/> and she made her return on 1 August 2011.<ref name="shenicearrives">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a331411/syed-finally-announces-his-engagement.html|title=Syed finally announces his engagement|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=1 August 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=26 July 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> {{-}}
==Ashley Chubb== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Ashley Chubb |portrayer = [[Colin Mace]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2011|Former; guest]] |first = 31 March 2011 |last = 2 June 2011 |years = 2011 |home = |sons = [[Fatboy (EastEnders)|Fatboy]] <!-- Please do not add Darius: Ashley called him Fatboy's uncle but did not specify if he was Ashley's brother or brother-in-law. No last name was mentioned. Please do not assume anything. --> }} '''Ashley Chubb''',<ref name="Ashley Chubb">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a299909/fatboys-father-to-join-eastenders.html|title=Fatboy's father to join 'EastEnders'|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=24 January 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=24 January 2011|location=London}}</ref> played by [[Colin Mace]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a306889/enders-confirms-fatboys-dad-casting.html|title='Enders confirms Fatboy's dad casting|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=3 March 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=3 March 2011|location=London}}</ref> is the father of established character [[Fatboy (EastEnders)|Fatboy]] ([[Ricky Norwood]]). He is mentioned in the episode broadcast on 14 March 2011 when Fatboy says his parents have split up because Ashley has lost his job. Ashley arrives in Walford two weeks later needing a place to stay. Fatboy invites him to stay with his friend [[Mercy Olubunmi]] ([[Bunmi Mojekwu]]) and her grandmother [[Grace Olubunmi]] ([[Ellen Thomas (actress)|Ellen Thomas]]), but has to sneak him in so Grace does not find out. Ashley then rents a room at the local bed and breakfast, run by [[Kim Fox]] ([[Tameka Empson]]). He asks Fatboy for money, saying he has a job interview out of town, but spends it on alcohol, telling Kim that he has done a one-off job for a friend. Fatboy discovers that Ashley is simply drinking away the money he lent him, and Kim leaves, telling Ashley not to stress about the rent. Fatboy tells Ashley that he is in love with Mercy, but she has a boyfriend, so in order to help Fatboy, he reports Mercy to the border agency for having an expired visa, which Fatboy told him about. Ashley then leaves Walford and two days later the [[UK Border Agency]] talk to Mercy and make her leave the country. Before she leaves, Fatboy proposes.
It was announced on 23 January 2011 that ''EastEnders'' producers were planning to expand Fatboy's family due to his popularity, and were in the process of casting his father.<ref name="Ashley Chubb" /> The part was cast to Mace, who filmed five episodes.<ref name="Walford Web Ashley">{{cite news|url=http://walfordweb.co.uk/item.php?id=2825|title=Fatboy's Father Found|date=2 March 2011|publisher=Walford Web|accessdate=2 March 2011}}</ref> Ashley is said to be a wheeler-dealer like his son.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.people.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/2011/01/23/eastenders-bosses-are-casting-a-father-for-fatboy-102039-22868571/|title=Eastenders bosses are casting a father for 'Fatboy'|last=Carlin|first=Thomas|work=[[The People]]|publisher=[[Trinity Mirror]]|language=23 January 2011|accessdate=24 January 2011}}</ref> Ashley's arrival is reported to be due to difficulties in his personal life. An ''EastEnders'' insider is reported to have said "Fatboy has been a real hit with viewers and the bosses have decided that it's now time to bring in his dad so people can see what Fatboy is really all about."<ref name="Ashley Chubb" /> Ashley has been described as "dishevelled".<ref name="Ashley arrives"/> Although Ashley only makes a guest appearance, Norwood expressed a hope for the character to return so the relationship between father and son could be further explored, adding, "There's great chemistry between Ashley and Fatboy".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a315614/eastenders-star-hopes-for-ashley-return.html|title='EastEnders' star hopes for Ashley return|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=20 April 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=20 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Ashley appeared in episodes between 31 March<ref name="Ashley arrives">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a308189/jack-loses-patience-over-ronnie.html|title=Jack loses patience over Ronnie|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]] | accessdate=10 March 2011|location=London|archivedate=10 March 2011|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5x5U97ykH}}</ref> and 21 April 2011. He returned once again on 31 May 2011.<ref name="30may">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 30/05/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b011mg62 |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: [[Clive Arnold]]; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Paul Mari |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=30 May 2011}}</ref> {{-}}
==Lydia Simmonds== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Lydia Simmonds |image= |caption= |image2= |caption2= |portrayer = [[Margaret Tyzack]] <br /> [[Heather Chasen]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2011|Former; recurring]] |first =5 April 2011 |last =13 June 2011 (appearance)<br />14 June 2011 (voiceover) |years = 2011 |home = 43a Albert Square |occupation = [[Retired]] |death=13 June 2011 |daughters =June Butcher |sons = [[#Norman Simmonds|Norman Simmonds]] |granddaughters=[[Janine Butcher]]<!-- Do not add characters who are not relevant to the storyline. Only Janine has been named has having any connection. Characters who are no longer in the series do not need to be included unless they are direct relatives. Ricky is only listed because he is still in the show, even though he may have no relevance to storylines --> |grandsons=[[Ricky Butcher]] }} '''Lydia Simmonds''', initially played by [[Margaret Tyzack]] and then by [[Heather Chasen]], is the maternal grandmother of [[Ricky Butcher|Ricky]] ([[Sid Owen]]) and [[Janine Butcher]] ([[Charlie Brooks]]). She made her first appearance on 5 April 2011.<ref name="5apr">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 05/04/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b0103wpx |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Jamie Annett; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Pete Lawson|network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=5 April 2011}}</ref> She left the series on 13 June 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a321651/a-sudden-loss-leaves-janine-devastated.html|title=A sudden loss leaves Janine devastated|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=May 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=26 May 2011|location=[[London]]|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5yyKXa61x|archivedate=26 May 2011}}</ref>
She is first seen when Janine visits her in hospital and realises that Lydia needs somewhere to stay. Lydia says she will sell her house and go into care, then sends Janine to her house to take photos, knowing that Janine will see how valuable the house is. Janine then invites Lydia to stay with her, and Lydia refuses, so Janine says that it is what Janine's mother and Lydia's daughter, June, would have wanted, so Lydia agrees. Although Janine believes she has manipulated Lydia, Lydia reveals to her nurse that she had in fact manipulated Janine. Lydia moves in and receives a letter that Janine tries to look at. Lydia tells Janine that she knows she is only interested in her money and wants her dead, but says Janine will have a long wait. On the [[wedding of Prince William and Kate Middleton]] she attends [[Dot Branning]]'s ([[June Brown]]) street party but insults her great-granddaughter [[Tiffany Butcher]] ([[Maisie Smith]]) so Dot wheels her to [[The Queen Victoria]] where she watches the wedding. She is seated in front of the television, blocking everyone's view, so [[Winston (EastEnders)|Winston]] ([[Ulric Browne]]) wheels her out of the way, pulling the cable out of the television, which causes it to lose picture. Lydia then manages to sell her house and so moves her belongings into Janine's flat and removes a canvas picture of Frank from Janine's living room. Janine disapproves but is forced to let her stay permanently. Later, Lydia then patronises everyone including [[Pat Evans]] ([[Pam St. Clement]]), Frank's mistress when he was still married to June. After moving in some furniture, Lydia struggles to stand, insisting she does not need help from Janine and slaps her when she tries to. While Janine is out, Lydia tries to reach her pills but falls out of her wheelchair. Janine is shocked to find her on the floor when she returns, and then helps her up. Lydia is unable to have an operation and is just put on stronger medicine. Lydia tells Janine that she will be fine, but Janine finds out from doctor [[Yusef Khan]] ([[Ace Bhatti]]) that she is worse than she says. Lydia bonds with Tiffany whilst she and Janine are looking after her. Janine tells Lydia that she likes having her around and wants her to stay. However, she wakes up one night saying she has seen June. She talks to Janine about her funeral and will, but Janine says she would rather have Lydia's photos of June than her money. Lydia asks to see the sun rise and hear the dawn chorus, and Janine opens the window for her. After this, Lydia quietly dies in her wheelchair and Janine is left in a state of shock.
===Development=== Described as feisty,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2002844/Eastenders-Whitney-Dean-Fatboy-fight-kissing-making-up.html?ito=feeds-newsxml|title=Whitney Dean and Fatboy fight before kissing and making up in final scenes of EastEnders prostitution story|date=13 June 2011|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|accessdate=13 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> twisted, manipulative, damaged<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/tv/2011/02/15/stage-star-margaret-tyzack-to-join-eastenders-115875-22923923/|title=Stage star Margaret Tyzack to join EastEnders|last=Methven|first=Nicola|date=15 February 2011|work=[[Daily Mirror]]|publisher=[[Trinity Mirror]]|accessdate=15 February 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> and "[a] lady of class and dignity", Lydia's backstory states that she loved her daughter June but hated the man June married, [[Frank Butcher]] ([[Mike Reid (entertainer)|Mike Reid]]), so she grew old alone and lived a life of solitude. Lydia and Janine were estranged for years and Janine is shocked to have her grandmother back in her life. The character and casting were announced on 15 February 2011, and of her casting, Tyzack said "I am delighted to be joining a great British tradition and a fine company of actors", and Executive Producer [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] said: "What a coup to have Margaret Tyzack starring in ''EastEnders''. She is an actress of incredible class and talent. Lydia has endless possibilities as a character, and I can't wait to see Janine meet her match."<ref name="Lydia">{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/eastenders/2011/02/margaret-tyzack.shtml|title=Janine's in for a shock... from Grandma|last=Humphreys|first=Matt|date=15 February 2011|work=EastEnders|publisher=[[BBC Online]] |accessdate=15 February 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Former ''EastEnders'' actress [[Natalie Cassidy]] predicted that Tyzack would be "fantastic" in the role.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a305274/natalie-cassidy-praises-enders-newcomer.html|title=Natalie Cassidy praises 'Enders newcomer|first=Daniel |last=Kilkelly|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|date=22 February 2011|accessdate=22 February 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> An ''EastEnders'' source revealed that Lydia is more of a schemer than Janine, saying "Janine is going to think there's a potential meal ticket arriving in the form of Lydia. But she's a very complex womanâand Janine won't be able to manipulate her as easily as she'd imagined."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/showbiz/article-23941273-eastenders-recasts-lydia-simmonds.do|title=EastEnders recasts Lydia Simmonds|date=13 April 2011|work=[[London Evening Standard]]|publisher=<!-- ? -->|accessdate=22 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref>
On 13 April 2011, it was reported that Tyzack had pulled out of the role for personal reasons.<ref name="chasen">{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a314250/eastenders-recasts-janines-grandmother.html|title='EastEnders' recasts Janine's grandmother|first=Daniel |last=Kilkelly|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|date=12 April 2011|accessdate=13 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Producers wanted to keep Lydia in the show as they had plans for her.<ref name="sunny">{{cite web|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/soaps/3524182/Blow-for-EastEnders-after-actress-hired-to-play-battle-axe-gran-pulls-out-after-a-week.html|title=Enders' granny has ended it|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|date=13 April 2011|accessdate=22 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Two episodes featuring Tyzack had already been broadcast,<ref name="5apr"/><ref name="7apr">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 07/04/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b0103wsp |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Jamie Annett; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Pete Lawson |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=9 April 2011}}</ref> and she featured in a further one on 14 April.<ref name="14apr">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 14/04/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b0106z6b |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Karl Neilson; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: [[Simon Ashdown]] |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=14 April 2011}}</ref> It was announced that 83-year-old (at the time of casting) Heather Chasen, who was previously best known for playing "super bitch" Valerie Pollard in [[ITV]] soap opera, ''[[Crossroads (soap opera)|Crossroads]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.atvtoday.co.uk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1042:crossroads-eastenders-chasen&catid=24:soap-news&Itemid=27|title=Heather Chasen from Kings Oak to Walford|accessdate=22 April 2011}}</ref> would replace Tyzack in the role, beginning filming on 15 April<ref name="chasen"/> for scenes to be broadcast from 21 April.<ref name="21apr">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 21/04/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b010mt7j |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: John Greening; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Christopher Reason |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=21 April 2011}}</ref> Brooks revealed in a exclusive interview with ''[[Inside Soap]]'' the effect Lydia has had on Janine saying, "Janine had no idea how much she'd fall in love with her grandma. [...] She recognises a lot of herself in Lydia, and finally understands where she gets a lot of her traits. It's nice to see the more vulnerable side of Janine and explore why she's turned out the way that she has. Having got to know her gran, Janine regrets not getting in touch with Lydia sooner. She didn't realise Lydia caredâshe thought she was just another family member who'd neglected her. Janine feels tremendously sad."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a323666/charlie-brooks-praises-eastenders-plot-climax.html|title=Charlie Brooks praises 'EastEnders' plot climax|first=Daniel |last=Kilkelly|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|date=7 June 2011|accessdate=7 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Brooks also said Janine would feel 'hurt' and 'furious' of people thinking she killed Lydia saying, "[Pat] actually accuses Janine of killing Lydia. Janine's hurt but also nonchalant about it. Janine denies it of course, but it's frustrating for her as this is one of the first times in her life that she is genuinely telling the truth."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a323880/eastenders-star-janine-will-be-furious.html|title='EastEnders' star: 'Janine will be furious'|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|date=8 June 2011|accessdate=8 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> {{-}}
==Cora Cross== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |image= |caption= |name = Cora Cross |portrayer = [[Ann Mitchell]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of EastEnders characters#Present characters|Present; regular]] |death = |first = 11 April 2011 |years = 2011â |home = |spinoffs = {{nowrap|''Lauren's Diaries'' (2011)<ref name="lauren's diaries">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/scoop/a346403/eastenders-lauren-delves-into-cross-family-history-video.html|title='EastEnders' Lauren delves into Cross family history - video|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=19 October 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=19 October 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref>}} |born = 2 August 1946 |occupation = Retired |husband = Bill Cross (until 1988) |daughters = [[Tanya Branning|Tanya Jessop]]<br />[[Rainie Cross]] |granddaughters=[[Lauren Branning]]<br />[[Abi Branning]] |grandsons=[[Oscar Branning]] }} '''Cora Cross''', played by [[Ann Mitchell]], is the mother of [[Tanya Branning]] ([[Jo Joyner]]) and [[Rainie Cross]] ([[Tanya Franks]]).<ref name="Cora Cross">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a310006/eastenders-confirms-tanyas-mum-casting.html|title='EastEnders' confirms Tanya's mum casting|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=21 March 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=21 March 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Cora initially appeared from 11 to 15 April 2011,<ref name="11apr">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 11/04/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b0106wtv |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Jamie Annett; Executive Producer: [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]]; Writer: Matt Evans |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=11 April 2011}}</ref><ref name="11aprDS">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a310850/tanya-receives-a-shock.html|title=Tanya receives a shock|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=March 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=4 April 2011|location=[[London]]|archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5xhP77fq6|archivedate=4 April 2011}}</ref><ref name="15april">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a312564/ronnie-comes-to-her-senses-at-last.html|title=Ronnie comes to her senses at last|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=15 April 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=19 July 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> and returned as a regular character on 28 July.<ref name="28July">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a330392/michael-vows-to-get-revenge-against-eddie.html|title=Michael vows to get revenge against Eddie|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=28 July 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=19 July 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref>
On her first appearance, she turns up at Tanya's house unannounced, and revealing that Tanya's fiancÃ© [[Greg Jessop]] ([[Stefan Booth]]) invited her to their wedding against Tanya's wishes.<ref name="Cora Cross" /> Rainie arrives at Tanya's house and Tanya is initially unhappy at the sight of Rainie but Cora vouches for her by promising that she is now clean from drugs and her counsellor thinks Rainie should reconnect with her family. Tanya soon softens towards her mother and sister. On Tanya's hen night, Cora takes a dislike to [[Vanessa Gold]] ([[Zoe Lucker]]) after Vanessa laughs about them living on a council estate. The next day, Tanya's ex-husband [[Max Branning]] ([[Jake Wood]]) goes to Tanya's house after tearing their daughter [[Abi Branning]]'s ([[Lorna Fitzgerald]]) bridesmaid dress; Tanya does not want to see him so Cora attempts to sort him out, claiming she knows how to "push his buttons". She tells Max that although the girls have his name, they are Crosses deep down. It is revealed that Rainie is staying at Cora's house. Cora then attends Tanya's wedding, and finds it amusing that [[Jane Beale]] ([[Laurie Brett]]) has kissed Greg the night before as Jane said he was kind to her when she was crying about a fight she had with Tanya when Tanya thought Jane was trying to get close to Greg. Cora says it is interesting, saying that Tanya would have ripped her eyes out if she had kissed Max when they were together. Cora departs after the wedding on 15 April, and Rainie later reveals that she has moved out of her mother's home.
Cora returns months later as she can no longer handle her abusive neighbours and asks to stay with Tanya for a few days. Tanya lets her stay longer, and on her birthday, she visits [[The Queen Victoria]] public house and meets [[Patrick Trueman]] ([[Rudolph Walker]]) and [[Alfie Moon]] ([[Shane Richie]]). She gets drunk and confronts Tanya about forgetting her birthday and how she treats Rainie. Cora also guesses that Tanya does not love Greg, but Tanya denies this. Cora reveals she has been evicted from her home because her neighbour has an ASBO, but when Cora, Tanya and Rainie return there to empty the house, the neighbour reveals that Cora is the one with the ASBO. She looks after Tanya's young son [[Oscar Branning]] (Charlee and Neo Hall) but he annoys her due to the noise he makes. She leaves him to play on the stairs and he falls, resulting in minor injuries.
Eventually Cora is forced to move out of Tanya's and convinces [[Dot Branning]] ([[June Brown]]) to let her stay with her. She asks [[Anthony Moon]] (Matt Lapinskas) to help her move her things, saying he can keep one of her belongings as payment. He asks for her candlesticks, but she says they are the only decent thing she owns, so she lets him buy them for Â£200. She later finds out they could be worth Â£1000, so convinces Anthony's father [[Eddie Moon|Eddie]] ([[David Essex]]) to give her an extra Â£300, but he believes them to be worth Â£8000. Dot later kicks Cora out for laughing at her and using language that Dot dislikes. Cora arrives at Tanya's house just as [[Shirley Carter]] ([[Linda Henry]]) is throtling Rainie so Cora fends Shirley off and threatens her. Tanya then lets Cora stay with her. When Max returns because Abi is worried about Tanya, it leads to Lauren revealing that Tanya has cervical cancer and has stopped her treatment. Tanya explains that she did not tell anyone because of how it was for her when her father, Bill, was dying of cancer. She then tells Cora and Rainie that Bill did not die peacefully as they thought, but he was in constant pain so Tanya helped him to die. Cora is initially horrified, but after Tanya explains further the circumstances surrounding Bill's death, they reconcile. Cora then vows to support Tanya through her illness.
===Creation and development=== Cora and her casting were announced on 21 March 2011, when she was described as having "a brash, outspoken attitude and does not care who she offends. She also quickly puts Tanya under scrutiny, believing that success has turned her into a snob".<ref name="Cora Cross" /> It was said that she secretly wants to heal the rift between Tanya and Rainie.<ref name="Cora BBC blog">{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/eastenders/2011/03/eastenders-cora-blimey-tanyas-mum.shtml|title=Cora blimey... it's Tanya's mum|last=Lou|date=21 March 2011|work=EastEnders|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=21 March 2011|location=London}}</ref> She has also been described as a "bolshie battleaxe".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/tv/858650-tanya-brannings-battleaxe-mum-to-make-surprise-visit-to-eastenders|title=Tanya Branning's battleaxe mum to make surprise visit to ''EastEnders''|last=''Metro'' TV reporter|date=21 March 2011|work=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|accessdate=22 March 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Mitchell said of her casting "As a lifelong fan of ''EastEnders'', I am thrilled to join the cast. I am a great fan of [[June Brown]]'s [who plays [[Dot Branning]]] and am looking forward to sharing some scenes with her."<ref name="Cora Cross" /> Executive producer [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] opined: "I'm very excited to have the much-loved Ann Mitchell joining us. Cora Cross is a formidable woman, cut from the same cloth as many glorious [[Walford]] women of the past, and Ann Mitchell is just perfect for the role."<ref name="Cora Cross" /> It is Mitchell's second role in ''EastEnders'', having previously played [[Jane Williams (EastEnders)|Jane Williams]] from 2001 to 2002.<ref name="Cora Cross" /> Cora initially appeared from 11<ref name="11apr"/><ref name="11aprDS"/> to 15 April 2011. On 31 May 2011, it was confirmed that Cora would be returning to ''EastEnders'' as a regular character. Kirkwood said, "We all love Cora hereâactress Ann Mitchell could be one of the Walford greats. She'll be returning late in the summer and is here to stay."<ref name="CoraReturn"/> Kirkwood added that he was keen to establish the Cross women.<ref name="CoraReturn"/>
The ''[[Daily Mail]]''{{'s}} Jaci Stephen deemed Cora "an archetypal East End matriarch".<ref name="JS"/> Stephen wrote: "brash and blunt, what she lacks in diplomacy she makes up for in style, even if that's not the way daughter Tanya always sees it. The role is a perfect fit for actress Ann who, as gangster Dolly Rawlins in ''[[Widows (TV series)|Widows]]'', was one of the Eighties' most iconic TV females.<ref name="JS">{{cite news|last=Stephen|first=Jaci|title=The ultimate insight into this week's soaps|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1374777/Jaci-Stephen-The-ultimate-insight-weeks-soaps.html|accessdate=16 April 2011|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|date=8 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Daniel Kilkelly from [[Digital Spy]] said, "During her brief stay on Albert Square, Cora quickly became known for her brash attitude and outspoken ways."<ref name="CoraReturn">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a322360/eastenders-exec-confirms-cora-cross-return.html|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' exec confirms Cora Cross return|date=31 May 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=31 May 2011}}</ref> {{-}}
==Martin== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Martin |portrayer = [[Alasdair Harvey]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2011|Former; guest]] |first = 26 April 2011 |last = 3 May 2011 |years = 2011 |home = |occupation = Bus driver }} '''Martin''', played by [[Alasdair Harvey]], is a love interest for [[Jane Beale]] ([[Laurie Brett]]),<ref name="Martin">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a313125/new-admirer-for-eastenders-jane-beale.html|title=New admirer for 'EastEnders' Jane Beale|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=6 April 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=6 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> who appears between 26 April<ref name="26apr">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 26/04/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b010r2wn |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Jerry Smith; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Roy Boulter |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=26 April 2011}}</ref> and 3 May 2011. He first appears when he is seen sitting at the bar of [[The Queen Victoria]] and Jane asks him to join her pub quiz team. Afterwards, Martin asks Jane to invite him next time. Martin passes his number to Jane via her brother [[Christian Clarke]] ([[John Partridge (performer)|John Partridge]]), asking her to call him. On Jane's 40th birthday, he turns up at the pub and goes over to Jane. They both lie about their lives and jobs, but as they are about to kiss, Martin says he cannot keep lying as he likes Jane too much, and says he's divorced with a child and lives in a pokey flat. Jane also tells the truth and stops Martin leaving, saying her house is not pokey and they can go there. They kiss as they enter the house but are surprised by Jane's husband [[Ian Beale]] ([[Adam Woodyatt]]) and his son [[Bobby Beale (EastEnders)|Bobby Beale]] (Alex Francis), throwing her a surprise dinner. The next day, Jane tries to end their brief relationship, but he kisses her, which Ian sees through the window, though Jane dumps him.
The ''[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]'' reported that Jane will have a one-night stand with Martin and viewers would be left wondering if she would confess to her husband, [[Ian Beale]] ([[Adam Woodyatt]]).<ref name="Martin 2">{{cite news|url=http://www2.dailystar.co.uk/playlist/view/184820/Eastenders-Jane-s-hunk/|title=EastEnders: Jane's hunk|last=Dyke|first=Peter|coauthors=Begley, Katie|date=6 April 2011|work=[[Daily Star (United Kingdom)|Daily Star]]|publisher=[[Northern & Shell]]|accessdate=6 April 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> However, an ''EastEnders'' source told [[Digital Spy]], "It doesn't go as far as a one-night stand, but Jane is flattered by the attention, they exchange phone numbers, there's some flirting and a couple of kisses."<ref name="Martin"/> Martin has been described as a "hunk".<ref name="Martin 2"/> {{-}}
==Marta Demboski== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Marta Demboski |portrayer = [[Magdalena Kurek]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2011|Former; guest]] |first = 6 May 2011 |last = 24 May 2011 |years = 2011 |home = |occupation = Carer |husband = }} '''Marta Demboski''', played by [[Magdalena Kurek]],<ref name="9may">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 09/05/2011|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b01126p9|series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Steve Finn; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Lucy Gannon|network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=9 May 2011}}</ref> is a [[Poles|Polish]] carer interviewed and subsequently hired by [[Dot Branning]] ([[June Brown]]),<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a316247/ian-and-janes-feud-spirals-out-of-control.html|title=Ian and Jane's feud spirals out of control|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=April 2011|accessdate=2 May 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> who appears from 6 to 24 May 2011. When she starts working, Dot is strict and wants everything done a certain way. Marta tells Dot's friend [[Edward Bishop (EastEnders)|Edward Bishop]] ([[Frank Barrie]]) that nothing she does is right in Dot's eyes. Dot later finds out that Marta is working nights as well, and Marta explains that her husband drinks and lost his job. She begs Dot not to tell the agency, and Dot allows her to continue working for her. When Marta returns a week later, Dot says she does not need any help and makes Marta look after her husband, [[Jim Branning]] ([[John Bardon]]), but Marta protests that that is not her job. The following day, Marta arrives late, annoying Dot. While Dot is looking through her purse, she finds a Â£10 note which she drops on the floor. She leaves the room, but comes back having lost the cash and accuses Marta of stealing it, thinking she put it on the table; Marta is fired by Dot. Dot later finds the money on the floor and regrets sacking Marta.
After Marta was seen smoking an [[electronic cigarette]], it was reported that some viewers who smoked had switched from real cigarettes. The electronic cigarettes were supplied by E-Lites, and Adrian Everett, one of the company's founders and directors, said: "[W]e were delighted to be asked to supply E-Lites to the makers of ''EastEnders'' as part of a new storyline. The fact that electronic cigarettes were featured in an everyday scene is a fantastic example of how our products are being accepted by the wider population. More people are becoming aware of E-Lites every day and this is yet another big step forward."<ref>{{cite press release|title=EastEnders picks up on growing trend as E-Lites enter soapland|publisher=Response Source|date=11 May 2011|url=http://www.responsesource.com/releases/rel_display.php?relid=64622|accessdate=11 May 2011}}</ref> {{-}}
==Eddie Moon== {{Main|Eddie Moon}} '''Eddie Moon''', played by [[David Essex]], is the father of [[Michael Moon (EastEnders)|Michael Moon]] ([[Steve John Shepherd]]), [[#Tyler Moon|Tyler Moon]] (Tony Discipline) and [[#Anthony Moon|Anthony Moon]] (Matt Lapinskas).{{Fact|date=November 2011}} Along with his children, Eddie was introduced to bring a "new generation" of the Moon family to the programme.{{Fact|date=November 2011}} Essex began filming in April 2011 and first appeared on screen on 3 June 2011.{{Fact|date=November 2011}} His initial contract ended in August, and Essex hopes he will be able to return to the role.{{Fact|date=November 2011}} The character has been described as cheeky, likeable and charismatic, and has a dark past.{{Fact|date=November 2011}} Through the series' narrative, it is revealed that there is a rift between Michael and Eddie, because Michael blames his father for the death of his mother, who killed herself when Michael was left alone with her.{{Fact|date=November 2011}} Eddie is also a love interest for [[Carol Jackson]] ([[Lindsey Coulson]]) and [[Vanessa Gold]] ([[Zoe Lucker]]).{{Fact|date=November 2011}}
Critics have responded mostly positively to the character, with Jaci Stephen from the ''[[Daily Mail]]'' calling the casting "inspired" and praising Essex's comic timing in the role.{{Fact|date=November 2011}} Tony Stewart from the ''[[Daily Mirror]]'' praised his "grand entrance" to the series, and a reporter from the ''[[Evening Chronicle]]'' said Eddie would bring a "breath of fresh air" to the soap.{{Fact|date=November 2011}} However, [[Jim Shelley (TV critic)|Jim Shelley]] from the ''Daily Mirror'' branded the character a "cliche".{{Fact|date=November 2011}}
==Shameem== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Shameem |image = |caption= |portrayer = [[Seeta Indrani]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of EastEnders characters#Past characters|Former; guest]] |first = 21 June 2011 |last = 23 June 2011 |years = 2011 |home = |occupation = |sisters= |husband= |nieces= [[Afia Khan]] }} '''Shameem''', played by [[Seeta Indrani]],<ref name="21jun"/> is the sister-in-law of [[Yusef Khan]] ([[Ace Bhatti]]) and aunt of [[Afia Khan]] ([[Meryl Fernandes]]). She appears on 21 and 23 June 2011.<ref name="21jun">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 21/06/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b0122m2f |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Jerry Smith; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: [[Daran Little]] |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=21 June 2011}}</ref><ref name="23jun">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 23/06/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b0122n4b |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Jerry Smith; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: [[Daran Little]] |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=23 June 2011}}</ref>
She appears when she arrives for Afia's mehndi to [[Tamwar Masood]] ([[Himesh Patel]]). She arrives before the mehndi to help out, at [[Kim Fox]]'s ([[Tameka Empson]]) bed and breakfast. Yusef introduces her to everyone and Shameem takes a instant dislike to Kim and her sister, [[Denise Fox]] ([[Diane Parish]]). Shameem is a witty and confident woman who is willing to drink in moderation despite her religion however she is also shown to be haughty and arrogant with a vicious tongue. She insults Denise in her own home and accuses her of wanting seduce Yusef. She is also annoyed at Afia for not doing a proper Muslim mehndi ceremony, though later agrees to it. She attends the mehndi and whilst she is outside, she overhears Yusef and his ex-wife [[Zainab Masood]] ([[Nina Wadia]]) talking about their history. She suspects they are having an affair, and tells all the guests at the mehndi, leaving everyone shocked. When Zainab tries to prove that she is not having an affair, her husband, [[Masood Ahmed]] ([[Nitin Ganatra]]) punches Yusef.
When it was reported that Shameem would suspect that Yusef and Zainab are having an affair, a source said, "The whole day turns into a disaster. When Shameem sees Yusef and Zainab together she automatically thinks they're having an affair. Everyone struggles to come to terms with what they have just heard. Afia is devastated and demands answers from her dad Yusef. He assures her it is all lies before leaving to find Zainab. It's one hell of a fall-out."<ref name="affair">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a324438/eastenders-zainab-wrongly-accused-of-affair.html|title='EastEnders' Zainab 'wrongly accused of affair'|last=Daniels|first=Colin|date=12 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=24 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> {{-}}
==Tyler Moon== {{Main|Tyler Moon}} '''Tyler Moon''', played by [[Tony Discipline]], is the son of [[Eddie Moon]] ([[David Essex]]), half brother<ref name="David Essex">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/interviews/a322231/david-essex-eddie-moon-eastenders.html|title=David Essex (Eddie Moon, 'EastEnders')|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=31 May 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=31 May 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> of [[Michael Moon (EastEnders)|Michael Moon]] ([[Steve John Shepherd]]), brother of [[Anthony Moon]] (Matt Lapinskas) and cousin of [[Alfie Moon]] ([[Shane Richie]]). The character was announced on 10 May 2011, along with Anthony, and made his first appearance on 27 June 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/proginfo/tv/2011/wk26/mon.shtml#mon_eastenders|title=Programme Information â Network TV BBC Week 26: Monday 27 June 2011 â EastEnders|date=June 2011|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Discipline heard about the part in November 2010 from his agent, so decided to audition and returned two weeks later for a workshop. At the workshop, there were six actors shortlisted to play Tyler and six shortlisted to play Anthony. The actors were paired off, and Discipline was paired with Lapinskas. A month later, Discipline attended a screen test, and after a further screen test, he found out he had got the part.<ref name="Tony Discipline interview" /> The younger of the brothers, Tyler was described as having a short fuse and "quick to use his fist to sort things out",<ref name="moon brothers">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a318629/eastenders-reveals-new-moon-arrivals.html|title='EastEnders' reveals new Moon arrivals|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=10 May 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=10 May 2011}}</ref> and the two new brothers are said to be "a couple of likely lads who are more than likely to cause a stir in Albert Square."<ref name="moon brothers" /> Discipline described Tyler as "very sparky and very charismatic! He can be quick to snap at certain people sometimes if they get on the wrong side of him, but he's a lovely guy. He's also very flirty when it comes to the women! He's a bit of a chap to say the least! It's not because he's seedy or he's horrible or anything like thatâhe genuinely enjoys chatting to women and chasing them. Even if they turned him down, it's all part of the chase and that's fun for Tyler. You can expect a lot of flirting, a lot of girls and maybe some arguments. We shall see!"<ref name="Tony Discipline interview" /> Daniel Kilkelly from [[Digital Spy]] added that the character has a lot of energy.<ref name="Tony Discipline interview">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/interviews/a325917/tony-discipline-eastenders-tyler-moon.html|title=Tony Discipline - 'EastEnders' Tyler Moon|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=21 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=21 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> {{-}}
==Norman Simmonds== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Norman Simmonds |portrayer = [[George Layton]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2011|Former; recurring]] |first = 5 July 2011 |last = 27 October 2011 |years = 2011 |home = |occupation = Loan dealer<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a345799/yusef-makes-a-shocking-suggestion-to-christian.html|title=Yusef makes a shocking suggestion to Christian|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]|accessdate=26 October 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> |mother = [[#Lydia Simmonds|Lydia Simmonds]] |sisters = June Butcher |nieces = [[Janine Butcher]] |nephews = [[Ricky Butcher]] }} '''Norman Simmonds''',<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2002844/Eastenders-Whitney-Dean-Fatboy-fight-kissing-making-up.html|title=Whitney Dean and Fatboy fight before kissing and making up in final scenes of EastEnders prostitution story|last=Daily Mail reporter|date=13 June 2011|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|accessdate=13 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> played by [[George Layton]], is the estranged son of [[#Lydia Simmonds|Lydia Simmonds]] ([[Heather Chasen]]).<ref name="Norman">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a324414/eastenders-casts-lydias-estranged-son.html|title='EastEnders' casts Lydia's estranged son|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=12 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=12 June 2011}}</ref> He is first mentioned in the episode broadcast on 9 June, when Lydia calls him a waste of space and says he will get nothing in her will. He arrives in [[Walford]] on 5 July,<ref name="5jul">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 05/07/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b012cxqz |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Lee Salisbury; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Carey Andrews. |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=5 July 2011}}</ref> as an "unexpected guest" at his mother's funeral.<ref name="Norman"/> Norman left ''EastEnders'' on 27 October 2011.<ref name="27oct">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 27/10/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b016k6n8|series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Lee Salisbury; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Lucy Gannon |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=27 October 2011}}</ref>
Norman goes to [[Pat Evans]]' ([[Pam St Clement]]) house and they recognise each other, and he mentions that he is widowed again, having been married five times. Norman's niece, [[Janine Malloy]] ([[Charlie Brooks]]) is angry with him because he never bothered with his mother while she was alive. A week later, Pat calls him and asks him to contest the will against Janine who is the sole beneficiary. The next day, Norman phones up Pat, and asks her to visit him in hospital after he stepped on a rake. Pat tries to persuade Norman not to contest the will after all, and he later agrees. It is clear that Norman likes Pat, but she is oblivious to this. [[Jean Slater]] ([[Gillian Wright]]) takes a liking to Norman and asks him to dress as a [[Pearly King]] to help with her campaign to stop the community centre closing. Jean hopes that she can be his Pearly Queen, but he asks Pat to do it instead, and she reluctantly agrees.
Norman asks Pat out but she rejects him, while Jean's liking of Norman intensifies. Jean agrees to go to a [[skiffle]] event with him. However, she misunderstands, as he is actually giving her both tickets and not going with her. Jean's relative [[Kat Moon]] ([[Jessie Wallace]]) confronts Norman for playing games but he insists he was never planning to go with Jean. This causes an argument between Kat, Pat and Janine, and Janine tells Norman that Pat used to be a prostitute. Norman tells Janine he is ashamed to be related to her. Jean soon becomes obsessed with Norman, constantly sending him text messages. She invites him to dinner, but he says no, saying he would not want to make a habit of it. Jean then mistakenly thinks Norman wants to live with her. He is shocked at this, and asks Kat's husband [[Alfie Moon|Alfie]] ([[Shane Richie]]) for help. Alfie makes things worse though, so Norman is forced to tell Jean that they should just be friends, as he feels she is too good for him.
When Pat discovers that her son, [[Simon Wicks]], who lives in New Zealand, is going to lose his home, she fails to get a loan because of her age. Norman offers to help and organises a loan for her. After speaking to her great grandson [[Liam Butcher]] ([[James Forde]]), Pat decides she likes Norman and they kiss, she also asks him to stay. However, the next day Norman tells [[Patrick Trueman]] ([[Rudolph Walker]]) that he regularly earns commission for organising loans for people. Patrick then warns Pat about this, and once Pat finds out that the terms of the loan mean if she misses a payment she could lose her house, she rejects Norman, tells him to leave and says she never wants to see him again.
[[Digital Spy]] reported that "sparks fly" when Norman runs into Pat Evans and he develops a soft spot for her.<ref name="Norman"/> The character and casting were announced on 12 June 2011.<ref name="Norman"/> Norman is described as "hapless, clumsy and unlucky in life."<ref name="Norman"/> Of his casting, Layton said "I am thrilled to be joining such a wonderful cast and crewâNorman is a great part and I'm excited to play him. I can't wait to get stuck into life in Albert Squareâand hopefully the odd tipple or three in [[The Queen Victoria|the Queen Vic]]!"<ref name="Norman"/> {{-}}
==Lola Pearce== {{main|Lola Pearce}} '''Lola Pearce''', played by [[Danielle Harold]], is the 15-year-old granddaughter of [[Billy Mitchell (EastEnders)|Billy Mitchell]] ([[Perry Fenwick]]) and [[Julie Perkins]] ([[Cathy Murphy]]).<ref name="Lola">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a323512/eastenders-casts-billy-mitchells-granddaughter.html|title='EastEnders' casts Billy Mitchell's granddaughter|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=7 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=7 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> The character and casting were announced on 7 June 2011<ref name="Lola" /> and Lola made her first appearance on 12 July 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://uk.tv.yahoo.com/soaps/article/19765/page-21/|title=Soap arrivals and departures|last=Horsley|first=Jon|date=30 June 2011|publisher=[[Yahoo!]]|accessdate=3 July 2011}}</ref><ref name="12jul">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 12/0<!-- Comment -->7/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b012jctt |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Lance Kneeshaw; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Matt Evans |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=12 July 2011}}</ref> When Billy and Julie decide to find their estranged son, Dan Pearce, they discover he has died but they have a granddaughter, Lola, who is in care. {{-}}
==Anthony Moon== {{main|Anthony Moon}} '''Anthony Moon''', played by [[Matt Lapinskas]],<ref name="Elmbridge Today">{{cite news|url=http://www.elmbridgetoday.co.uk/Community/Brooklands-College-student-Eastenders-0000000235.aspx|title=Former Brooklands student joins Eastenders cast|date=19 May 2011|work=Elmbridge Today|accessdate=19 May 2011|location=[[Elmbridge]]}}</ref> is the son of [[Eddie Moon]] ([[David Essex]]), half brother<ref name="David Essex" /> of [[Michael Moon (EastEnders)|Michael Moon]] ([[Steve John Shepherd]]), brother of [[#Tyler Moon|Tyler Moon]] (Tony Discipline), and cousin of [[Alfie Moon]] ([[Shane Richie]]).
