The character made his first appearance in the episode broadcast on 25 July 2011.<ref name="25jul"/> Anthony, along with brother Tyler, were both announced as new characters in May 2011,{{Fact|date=October 2011}} being played by Lapinskas and Discipline respectively, though Tyler made his debut at an earlier date. Described as someone who "will rely on his brains and natural wit to find a more sensitive solution to any conflict",{{Fact|date=October 2011}} it is shown that Anthony has a gambling problem before his arrival, which is later a focus of a storyline. Lapinskas said of his relationship with half brother Michael that Anthony "idolises" him and that Michael "corrupted" Anthony.{{Fact|date=October 2011}} When Eddie leaves, Anthony takes charge of his antiques business. {{-}}
==Lee== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Lee |portrayer = Mitchell Hunt |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2011|Former; guest]] |first = 15 August 2011 |last = 29 August 2011 |years = 2011 }} '''Lee''', played by Mitchell Hunt, is a friend of [[#Rob Grayson|Rob Grayson]] ([[Jody Latham]]), who lures his ex, [[Whitney Dean]] ([[Shona McGarty]]), back into Rob's hands.<ref>{{cite journal|date=30 July - 5 August|title=Storyline sneak peak|journal=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|Buzz]]|publisher=[[News Group Newspapers]]|issue=45|page=36}}</ref> He appears between 15 August<ref name="15aug">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 15/0<!-- Comment -->8/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b013gkcn |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Karl Neilson; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Jesse O'Mahoney |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=15 August 2011}}</ref> and 29 August 2011.<!-- source needed-->
Lee approaches Whitney in Walford's cafÃ©, where she refuses to let him pay for her. Later, he apologises and says he will go for a drink with her if he buys something from her market stall. She calls him a pervert and tells him to leave. He later talks to her again and asks for her phone number. Whitney is eventually convinced to do so. Lee takes Whitney bowling, and afterwards they kiss. When Whitney texts Lee that she wants to meet again, it is revealed that Lee is a friend of Rob, who previously forced Whitney into prostitution, and Lee hands his phone to Rob. After Rob is killed in a fight with Whitney's brother [[Ryan Malloy]] ([[Neil McDermott]]), Lee visits Whitney and tells her not to get his name involved as police have visited him. She tells him to leave, deliberately causing a scene, and he leaves.
Speaking of his time on ''EastEnders'', Hunt said in an interview, "It was great. It was my first job out of drama school, as I only finished a few weeks before. I had to jump straight into it, but everyone was so nice. The cast and crew really are just like one big family. Everything moves so fast. There are four cameras on you at any one time, so there is no room for error." Hunt also hoped for a return for Lee, saying, "Well, my character doesn't die, so there's always hope!"<ref name="gazettel">{{cite news|url=http://www.gazette-news.co.uk/news/9180872.I___ve_landed_a_part_in_EastEnders___weeks_after_leaving_drama_school/|title=Iâve landed a part in EastEnders...weeks after leaving drama school|date=6 August 2011|work=Gazette|accessdate=10 Ocotber 2011}}</ref> {{-}}
==Rose Cotton== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Rose Cotton |portrayer = [[Polly Perkins (singer)|Polly Perkins]] |image = |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of EastEnders characters#Present characters|Present; regular]] |first = 22 August 2011 |last = |years = 2011â |born = 1 December 1941 |home = |husband = [[Charlie Cotton]] |mother=Martha Colwell |sons = [[#Andrew Cotton|Andrew Cotton]] |brothers=Gerry Taylor<br />Tim Taylor |halfsisters = [[Dot Branning]] |occupation = Receptionist (since 2011) }} '''Rose Elizabeth Cotton''' (nÃ©e '''Colwell'''; previously '''Taylor''' and '''Beauchamp'''), played by [[Polly Perkins (singer)|Polly Perkins]], is the estranged half sister of [[Dot Branning]] ([[June Brown]]). She is first seen when Dot goes to visit her in [[Southend-on-Sea]] where she lives, as she has decided to make amends before she dies. Dot sees Rose in a bar, drinking and flirting with a group of men, and leaves without speaking to her. She later follows her to an address, and Rose lies that she is well off and her husband has died. Dot leaves but returns when she realises she has left something behind. She finds that the dead man is alive and Rose has lied about everything. Dot goes to her actual home and Rose admits she did not want Dot to think bad of her. Dot tells Rose she may not have long to live and did not want to die before making amends. They start to bond, and Dot meets Rose's son [[#Andrew Cotton|Andrew]] ([[Ricky Grover]]), and there is animosity between mother and son. Before Dot is due to leave, Rose asks to spend some more time with her. Dot says as they are both lonely, Rose should live with her in [[Walford]], and Rose agrees. Andrew drives them there but reveals his last name is Cotton, and Rose is forced to admit that Andrew's father is Dot's first husband [[Charlie Cotton]], who had a bigamous marriage with Rose. Dot kicks Rose out but she later returns, saying she does not want to lose her sister again.
Rose moves in and Dot urges her to earn money. When Dot gossips to her about [[Jean Slater]] ([[Gillian Wright]]) and her family, Rose uses this information to make Jean think she is psychic, and Jean pays her for her services. She then gets a trial working for Doctor [[Yusef Khan]] ([[Ace Bhatti]]) as his receptionist. She gets the job and appears to enjoy it, although her constant pining over Yusef appears to irritate him somewhat. Rose reveals to Dot that she is behind with the paperwork at the surgery while Yusef has been away. Dot helps Rose sort through her workload, but they discover that Rose has misplaced some test results for a patient who has since died. Rose fears her oversight resulted in the patient's death, but [[Reverend Stevens]] ([[Michael Keating (actor)|Michael Keating]]) tells her the patient died of a bee sting. A relieved Rose then flirts with Reverend Stevens, much to the chagrin of Dot. A few days later, Dot reveals Rose's shady past to Reverend Stevens. However, the Reverend is intrigued, and he and Rose share a drink at [[The Queen Victoria]] public house, as he wants to know more about her life. Rose brings alcohol to a church social event, which Dot is against, but Reverend Stevens thanks Dot for making it the best so far. Rose and Reverend Stevens grow closer at the event, resulting in him asking for Dot's blessing to date Rose. Rose later sleeps with [[Patrick Trueman]] ([[Rudolph Walker]]) upsetting Reverend Stevens. Cora finds this funny but Dot kicks Cora out for laughing. Rose later apologises to Dot for embarrassing her and forgives Dot for the things she said, however, Dot asks Rose to move back to Southend. Dot also discovers Rose's passport which reveals Rose had remarried again and had the surname of Beauchamp. When Dot confronts her, Rose reveals that the marriage was abusive. Dot then allows Rose to move back in with her.
===Development=== The casting of Perkins in the role was announced on 27 May 2011 and the character first appeared on screen on 22 August 2011.<ref name="22aug">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 22/08/2011 |http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b013spj2 |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Tim Mercier; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Matthew Barry |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=22 August 2011}}</ref> She is described as "flighty, fun and not one to age gracefully".<ref name="Rose" /> Rose and Dot have been estranged for most of their lives, since Rose had an affair with Dot's first husband, [[Charlie Cotton]]. Dot decides to track Rose down after suffering a bout of hypochondria, feeling it is time to put things right, however, Rose is not pleased to see Dot again after so many years.<ref name="Polly Press">{{cite press release|title=Polly Perkins joins the cast of EastEnders|publisher=BBC|date=27 May 2011|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/pressreleases/stories/2011/05_may/27/polly.shtml|accessdate=27 May 2011}}</ref> Perkins said of her casting, "I am thrilled to be joining the cast of ''EastEnders'', the show is a real British institution with an extraordinary creative team. I'm really looking forward to working with June again, who I have been friends with for over 30 years."<ref name="Rose">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a321731/eastenders-casts-dot-brannings-sister.html|title='EastEnders' casts Dot Branning's sister|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=27 May 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=27 May 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> Perkins and Brown were pictured filming scenes on a beach in [[Thorpe Bay]] in Essex. A spokesperson said "All I'll say is we are filming some big episodes, which we plan to broadcast later this summer. It's not our policy to comment on episodes like this so early."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.echo-news.co.uk/news/9069494.EastEnders_Dot_Cotton_filming_in_Thorpe_Bay/|title=EastEnders Dot Cotton filming in Thorpe Bay|last=McCarthy|first=Ryan|date=7 June 2011|work=Echo|publisher=[[Newsquest Media Group]]|accessdate=7 June 2011|location=[[Basildon]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1395007/EastEnders-Dot-long-lost-sister-Rose-emotional-reunion.html|title=Emotional reunion for EastEnder Dot and her long-lost sister Rose|last=Daily Mail reporter|date=6 June 2011|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|accessdate=6 June 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> {{-}}
==Andrew Cotton== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Andrew Cotton |portrayer = [[Ricky Grover]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of EastEnders characters#Returning characters|Former; guest (returning)]] |first = 22 August 2011 |last = |years = 2011â |home = <!-- 74c Whitmore Street, --> [[Southend-on-Sea]] |occupation = Doorman |father = [[Charlie Cotton]] |mother = [[#Rose Cotton|Rose Cotton]] |halfbrothers= [[Nick Cotton]] |aunts= [[Dot Branning]] }} '''Andrew Cotton''', played by [[Ricky Grover]], is a new love interest for [[Heather Trott]] ([[Cheryl Fergison]])<ref name="ricky grover">{{cite news|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/tv/soaps/3632058/Linda-Henry-bags-a-ride-in-a-bumper-car-with-EastEnders-newcomer-Ricky-Grover.html|title=Taken for a ride, Shirley?|date=11 June 2011|work=[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]|publisher=[[News International]]|first=Colin|last=Robertson|accessdate=11 June 2011}}</ref> who first appears on 22 August 2011.<ref name="22aug"/> Andrew is first seen when Heather and her friend [[Shirley Carter]] ([[Linda Henry]]) go to a 1980s music festival in [[Southend-on-Sea]], though Heather has not told Shirley it is for couples. Shirley walks out but when she returns, it is too late for them to gain entry, but Andrew, who is working on the door, decides to let them in anyway. Heather tells Andrew she and Shirley are lesbians as the event is for couples, but he thinks Heather is lying, and she admits it. When Andrew talks to Shirley, she says Heather is not interested, and Heather thinks Andrew is more interested in Shirley. Eventually, Shirley tells Heather that Andrew likes her, but did not tell her in case it was purely for a bet. This upsets Heather, who tells Andrew the bet is off. Heather soon realises she was wrong, and meets Andrew in the restaurant of the hotel where she is staying. Heather's friend [[Dot Branning]] ([[June Brown]]) arrives with her half sister [[#Rose Cotton|Rose Cotton]] ([[Polly Perkins (singer)|Polly Perkins]]) and it is revealed that Andrew is Rose's son and they do not get on. Andrew and Rose trade insults at the table and he and Heather decide to leave. Heather tells Andrew he should not speak to his mother that way and decides to leave. Andrew finds out Rose has decided to live with Dot, and will be left on his own. He drives them back to [[Walford]] and finds Heather, and she says she will find him next time she is in Southend. He gives her his name as Andrew Cotton, revealing to Dot that his father is her first husband [[Charlie Cotton]], and that he had a third bigamous marriage. Andrew then returns to Southend.
The character of Andrew was first announced when the ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' pictured scenes filmed in Southend-on-Sea showing Heather and her friend Shirley going to a music convention where they see Andrew.<ref name="ricky grover"/> The newspaper described him as "a dodgy geezer."<ref name="ricky grover"/> In November 2011, executive producer [[Bryan Kirkwood]] told ''[[Inside Soap]]'' that Andrew would be returning to ''EastEnders'' to woo Heather.<ref>{{cite journal|date=19â25 November 2011|title=Secrets of the Square|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]|issue=46|page=39|accessdate=15 November 2011}}</ref> {{-}}
==Faith Olubunmi== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |image= |caption= |name= Faith Olubunmi |portrayer=[[Modupe Adeyeye]] |introducer=[[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |years=2011 |first= 13 September 2011 |last= 20 September 2011 |classification=[[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2011|Former; guest]] |born= |home= |spinoffs=''[[EastEnders: E20]]'' (2011) |sisters=[[Mercy Olubunmi]] |grandmothers= [[Grace Olubunmi]] }} {{see also|List of EastEnders: E20 characters#Faith Olubunmi}} '''Faith Olubunmi''',<ref name="meet the cast">{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/eastenders/e20/about/series_three_cast.shtml|title=Series 3: Meet the cast|work=EastEnders: E20|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=25 June 2011}}</ref> played by [[Modupe Adeyeye]], is the younger sister of [[Mercy Olubunmi]] ([[Bunmi Mojekwu]]). Faith is one of three main characters in the third series of ''EastEnders'' spin-off ''[[EastEnders: E20]]'', and the only one to appear in ''EastEnders'' as well. She appears in ''EastEnders'' from 13 September 2011, before appearing in the spin-off. Faith was sent to Nigeria by her grandmother [[Grace Olubunmi]] ([[Ellen Thomas (actress)|Ellen Thomas]]) "to get back on the straight and narrow, but she is back and worse than ever!"<ref name="Series 3 characters"/> She arrives in [[Walford]] to tell Mercy's husband [[Fatboy (EastEnders)|Fatboy]] ([[Ricky Norwood]]) that she has had the marriage annulled and asks for his wedding ring so she can sell it. She stays with Grace and attends a party where she kisses several men. Faith later holds a party at Grace's house and she has sex with Fatboy but they are caught by Grace. The next day, when Faith returns home drunk, Grace slaps her and kicks her out of the house. In ''EastEnders: E20'', she is unable to find anywhere to live so starts squatting with [[Donnie Lester]] ([[Samuell Benta]]) and [[Ava Bourne]] (Sophie Colquhoun).
Faith is described as someone who can be "an incredible amount of fun and excitement, and she has a cheekiness that charms most people. But she's not nearly as bright as she thinks she isâshe can sometimes be reckless and downright dangerous. When Faith runs into [''E20'' characters] [[Donnie Lester|Donnie]] and [[Ava Bourne|Ava]], she sees it as her chance to cause even more mischief!"<ref name="Series 3 characters">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/scoop/a326288/eastenders-e20-guide-to-the-new-characters.html|title='EastEnders: E20': Guide to the new characters|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=23 June 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=23 June 2011|location=London}}</ref> Faith also has a profile on Twitter.<ref name="About series 3">{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p00k0bg4/features/about|title=About Series 3|work=EastEnders: E20|publisher=[[BBC Online]]|accessdate=13 September 2011}}</ref> In September, Adeyeye told ''[[Digital Spy]]'' that she had finished filming for ''EastEnders''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' Modupe Adeyeye on Faith, Fatboy, 'E20', main show and more: Interview|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s86/eastenders-e20/interviews/a341230/eastenders-modupe-adeyeye-on-faith-fatboy-e20-main-show-and-more-interview.html|work=''[[Digital Spy]]''|accessdate=11 Ocotber 2011}}</ref> {{-}}
==Craig Moon== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Craig Moon |portrayer = [[Elliot Rosen]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2011|Former; guest]] |first = 16 September 2011 |last = 6 October 2011 |years = 2011 |born = 13 March 1976<ref>{{cite journal|last=Tyler|first=Laura-Jayne|date=13â19 August 2011|title=Michael's evil plot!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|issue=32|page=6|accessdate=14 August 2011}}</ref> |father= [[Eddie Moon]] |mother= Maggie Moon |brothers = [[Michael Moon (EastEnders)|Michael Moon]] |halfbrothers = [[Tyler Moon]]<br>[[Anthony Moon]] |halfsisters = Francesca Moon |nephews=[[Tommy Moon]] |relatives=[[Alfie Moon]]<br />[[Spencer Moon]] }} '''Craig Moon''', played by [[Elliot Rosen]], is the long-lost brother of [[Michael Moon (EastEnders)|Michael Moon]] ([[Steve John Shepherd]]), and son of [[Eddie Moon]] ([[David Essex]]).<ref name="Craig">{{cite news|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' to introduce another new Moon|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a331351/eastenders-to-introduce-another-new-moon.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=24 July 2011|date=24 July 2011}}</ref>
Craig first appears when Eddie takes Michael to see him in a care home.<ref name="HorizonMoon"/> Michael initially refuses to meet Craig and when he learns he has [[Down's syndrome]], Michael walks away in shock.<ref name="HorizonMoon"/> Eddie reveals Craig is his full-brother, as Michael assumes Eddie had an affair. After Eddie leaves, Craig asks Michael if he has a necklace like the one he shows him, and Michael shows his, and the pair bond. Craig later meets his half brothers [[Anthony Moon]] (Matt Lapinskas) and [[Tyler Moon]] ([[Tony Discipline]]), and they plan a treasure hunt for Craig in [[Albert Square]]. When Eddie plans to leave Walford for [[Spain]] with his family but Tyler and Anthony refuse to go, so Eddie and Craig go without them, to live with Frankie.
The character and casting was announced on 24 July 2011<ref name="Craig"/> and Craig first appeared on 16 September 2011.<ref name="16sep">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 16/09/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b014qsdd |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: [[Clive Arnold]]; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Perrie Balthazar |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=16 September 2011}}</ref><ref name="HorizonMoon">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2018194/EastEnders-introduces-Downs-syndrome-actor-Elliot-Rosen-soap-cast.html|title=New Moon on the horizon as EastEnders introduces Down's syndrome actor Elliot Rosen to play Eddie's son|date=24 July 2011|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|accessdate=24 July 2011}}</ref> Craig is Rosen's first high profile role, having had in small parts in ''[[Holby City]]'' and ''[[Peak Practice]]''.<ref name="HorizonMoon"/> ''EastEnders'' worked closely with the [[Down's Syndrome Association]] whilst devising the storyline and were praised for "Presenting people with Down's Syndrome living successful lives."<ref name="Craig"/> A spokesperson for the show added they were committed to raising issues such as Down's syndrome.<ref name="Craig"/> {{-}}
==Yasmin Masood== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Yasmin Masood |image = |portrayer = |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of EastEnders characters#Present characters|Present; recurring]] |first = 10 October 2011 |last = |years = 2011â |born = 31 October 2010<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a347008/amira-is-branded-a-liar-by-christian.html|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hearst Magazines UK]]|title=Amira is branded a liar by Christian|accessdate=25 October 2011}}</ref> |father= [[Syed Masood]] |mother= [[Amira Shah]] |grandfathers=[[Masood Ahmed]] <br/> [[Qadim Shah]] |grandmothers=[[Zainab Masood]] |uncles=[[Tamwar Masood]] <br/> [[Kamil Masood]] |aunts=[[Shabnam Masood]] }} '''Yasmin Masood'''<ref>{{cite journal|date=1-7 October 2011|title=Amira Returns!|journal=[[Inside Soap]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|issue=39|page=95|accessdate=27 September 2011}}</ref> is the daughter of [[Syed Masood]] ([[Marc Elliot]]) and [[Amira Shah]] ([[Preeya Kalidas]]). Yasmin is mentioned in two extra scenes available on [[BBC Online]] and [[BBC Red Button]], called ''Amira's Secret'', on 6 and 8 September 2011, when Amira reveals that no man will want her anymore, as she has Yasmin. Yasmin appears in the second scene. Yasmin made her first appearance in ''EastEnders'' on 10 October 2011.<ref name="10yasmin">{{cite news|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title=Yusef discovers Amira's secret |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a343534/yusef-discovers-amiras-secret.html|work=''[[Digital Spy]]''|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=10 October 2011|airdate=10 October 2011}}</ref>
Amira leaves Walford after finding out Syed is having a gay affair with [[Christian Clarke]] ([[John Partridge (actor)|John Partridge]]), though she is carrying Syed's baby, which he does not know about.<ref name="amira">{{cite news|last=Green|first=Kris|title=Amira flees Walford as the truth is revealed |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/spoilers/a214434/amira-flees-walford-as-the-truth-is-revealed.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 September 2011|date=26 April 2010}}</ref> When Amira returns to Walford over a year later, she meets [[Yusef Khan]] ([[Ace Bhatti]]), who believes she has arrived to give Syed a divorce. However, Amira reveals that she wants Syed to meet his daughter. Yusef tries to persuade her she is doing the wrong thing and that Syed will want custody of Yasmin. Amira turns up at Syed and Christian's engagement party and tells Syed he has a daughter. Amira explains she does not want Christian anywhere near Yasmin, but Syed refuses to see his daughter without Christian. However, he later meets up with Amira and Yasmin in the park. Amira tries to manipulate Syed into spending more time with her and Yasmin. Amira lies, saying that Yasmin has swallowed her ring, leading to Yasmin going for an unnecessary trip to the hospital.
Yusef, trying to tear the Masood family apart, tells Christian that Syed may not be Yasmin's father. Christian goes behind Syed's back to have a paternity test done, taking a hair from each of them. However, Yusef, who is the local GP, swaps Syed's hair sample for one of his own. The test results then appear to show that Syed is not Yasmin's father, causing consternation for those involved, though Yusef's falsification is subsequently exposed.
===Development=== In August 2011, it was revealed that Amira had "[gone] ahead with the pregnancy and will come back with a little girl", and Kalidas promised a lot of drama.<ref name="baby reveal">{{cite news|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' Preeya Kalidas reveals Amira return secrets |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a333898/eastenders-preeya-kalidas-reveals-amira-return-secrets.html|work=''[[Digital Spy]]''|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 September 2011|date=8 August 2011}}</ref> Kalidas said Amira still loves Syed after what he did, and that Amira wants to get back with Syed as she "doesn't want her daughter to grow up without knowing her father". She said that Amira cannot move on from Syed, as Yasmin is a constant reminder of him.<ref name="amira loves">{{cite news|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' Amira still loves Syed, reveals Preeya Kalidas |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a342658/eastenders-amira-still-loves-syed-reveals-preeya-kalidas.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 September 2011|date=28 September 2011}}</ref> [[Nina Wadia]], who plays Syed's mother [[Zainab Masood|Zainab]], said of the storyline, "I can't wait for Syed's baby to come. I think it will help Zainab and Syed get closer as she'll want her grandchild and it may make her feel like her son is a proper man."<ref name="zainab/syed">{{cite news|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|title='EastEnders' Zainab will get closer to Syed, predicts Nina Wadia |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a341094/eastenders-zainab-will-get-closer-to-syed-predicts-nina-wadia.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 September 2011|date=19 September 2011}}</ref> Elliot said in May 2010 that Amira being pregnant was "a real shocker".<ref name="shock">{{cite news|last=Green|first=Kris|title=Marc Elliott (Syed Masood, 'EastEnders') |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/interviews/a217924/marc-elliott-syed-masood-eastenders.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=28 September 2011|date=4 May 2010}}</ref> {{-}}
==Mark Garland== {{Infobox soap character 2 |series = EastEnders |name = Mark Garland |image = |portrayer = [[Chris Simmons]] |introducer = [[Bryan Kirkwood (producer)|Bryan Kirkwood]] |classification = [[List of past EastEnders characters#Last appeared in 2011|Former; guest]] |first = 14 October 2011 |last = 17 October 2011 |years = 2011 |born = |occupation= Delivery driver<ref name="mark metro"/> }} '''Mark Garland''',<ref name="20oct">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 20/10/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b01684cv |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Karl Neilson; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Christopher Reason |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=20 October 2011}} </ref> played by [[Chris Simmons]], is a love interest for [[Kat Moon]] ([[Jessie Wallace]]).<ref name="mark metro">{{cite news|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/tv/877749-eastenders-kat-moon-tempted-to-cheat-on-alfie-with-new-character-mark|title=EastEnders' Kat Moon tempted to cheat on Alfie with new character Mark|date=6 October 2011|work=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|accessdate=9 October 2011|location=[[London]]}}</ref> He first appears on 14 October 2011,<ref name="14oct">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 14/10/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b015ymq0 |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Mickey Jones; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Michael Begley |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=14 October 2011}}</ref> when he is delivering alcohol to [[The Queen Victoria]] public house, of which Kat is a landlady. Mark tries to flirt with Kat but she tells him she is married. Mark later appears in the local nightclub, [[R&R (EastEnders)|R&R]], where he tries to chat up Kat once again, this time succeding and they have a one-night stand. The next day he returns at the Queen Vic and reminds her about the previous night and Kat refuses to serve him and makes Mark leave. The next day he continues to phone her, but she rejects his calls.
It was reported that Kat faces temptation from Mark when she goes through marriage problems with her husband, [[Alfie Moon]] ([[Shane Richie]]), after he accuses her of having an affair.<ref name="mark metro"/> A source from ''EastEnders'' said, "A delivery driver who calls at [[The Queen Victoria|the Queen Vic]] makes a big play for Katâand soon she's facing serious temptation".<ref name="mark metro"/> Despite Kat and Mark flirting, it is unknown whether she will succumb to his charms. The ''[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]'' described him as "hunky" and "good looking".<ref name="mark metro"/> {{-}}

He later reports Ian and Mandy for stealing his money, which Mandy has hidden in Ian's car. |- ! scope="row" | {{nowrap|DC Towers}}{{Anchor|DC Towers}} | 30 August | {{nowrap|[[Grant Ibbs]]<ref name="30aug"/>}} | An undercover police officer who questions [[Ian Beale]] after he was wrongly arrested for soliciting. |- ! scope="row" | {{nowrap|Geoff}} | 2 September | {{nowrap|[[David Gillies (actor)|David Gillies]]<ref name="2sep"/>}} | {{Anchor|Geoff}} A man who [[Rainie Cross]] lets stay at her sister [[Tanya Jessop]]'s house overnight because his wife has left him. |- ! scope="row" | {{nowrap|Duncan Willis <br />or Wilkins}} | 2â29 September | {{nowrap|[[Steven France]]<ref name="2sep">{{Cite episode |title= Episode dated 02/09/2011 |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b01421p0 |series= EastEnders |serieslink=EastEnders |credits= Director: Lee Salisbury; Executive Producer: Bryan Kirkwood; Writer: Jake Riddell |network=[[BBC]] |station=[[BBC One]] |city= |airdate=2 September 2011}}</ref>}} | {{Anchor|Duncan Willis|Duncan Wilkins}} A 16-year-old boxer brought to Walford by [[Michael Moon (EastEnders)|Michael Moon]]. He then befriends [[Ben Mitchell (EastEnders)|Ben Mitchell]]. When Ben decides he wants to box, his father [[Phil Mitchell]] pairs him with Duncan. Duncan tells Ben to look into his eyes as they are fighting, causing Ben to blush. Later, when Duncan tends to Ben's injured hand, Ben kisses Duncan,<ref name="Duncan">{{cite news|last=Goodacre|first=Kate|title='EastEnders' character to come out as gay|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s2/eastenders/news/a330877/eastenders-character-to-come-out-as-gay.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=21 July 2011}}</ref> and immediately apologises, but Duncan kisses him back. A few days later, they take a break from training and kiss in the alleyway again, and are seen by [[Patrick Trueman]]. Things go wrong between Ben and Patrick, which causes Phil to start threatening Patrick, so Duncan tells Ben things between them were only a bit of fun, and he decides to change to a different gym. Duncan is credited as Duncan Willis but is referred to as Duncan Wilkins in the show. |- ! scope="row" | {{nowrap|Mr Waverly}} | 2 September | {{nowrap|[[David Acton]]<ref name="2sep"/>}} | {{Anchor|Mr Waverly}} [[Tanya Jessop]]'s consultant when she is tested for [[cervical cancer]]. When Tanya's daughter [[Lauren Branning|Lauren]] goes to the hospital to her mother, she meets Sam. Although Sam only says to Lauren that she needs to speak to her mother urgently, Lauren understands that this means that Tanya has not been going to her treatment sessions. Tanya resumes her therapy, and Sam, along with [[#Dr Faye Morrison|Dr Faye Morrison]], talk her through what will happen. |- ! scope="row" | {{nowrap|Siobhan}} | 10 October | {{nowrap|[[Sara Stephens]]<ref name="10oct"/>}} | {{Anchor|Siobhan}} A woman who [[Tanya Jessop]] meets before her first chemotherapy session.
